tags.label: Electronic
tags.description: Music primarily created with electronic instruments like synthesizers and drum machines.

tags.label: Trance
tags.description: Driving, melodic electronic music, typically around 130-140 BPM. Examples: "For an Angel" by Paul van Dyk, "Adagio for Strings" by Tiësto.

tags.label: Progressive Trance
tags.description: Trance with a focus on gradual build-ups and evolving melodies. Examples: "Café Del Mar" by Energy 52, Sasha & Digweed.

tags.label: Psytrance
tags.description: Hypnotic, fast-paced trance characterized by a distinctive, squelchy, and rapidly repeating bassline. Examples: Infected Mushroom, Astrix.

tags.label: Psybient
tags.description: A fusion of psytrance and ambient music, often with slower tempos and complex soundscapes.

tags.label: Goa Trance
tags.description: An early, more organic form of psytrance known for its intricate melodic patterns.

tags.label: House
tags.description: Electronic dance music characterized by a 4/4 time signature, typically around 120-130 BPM.

tags.label: Deep House
tags.description: A slower, more soulful variant of house music with complex melodies and mellow vibes. Examples: "Finally" by Kings of Tomorrow, "The Cure & The Cause" by Fish Go Deep.

tags.label: Slap House
tags.description: A modern, bass-driven subgenre of house music known for its punchy, "slapping" basslines and often featuring pop vocal covers. Examples: "Breaking Me" by Topic & A7S, "Your Love (9PM)" by ATB, Topic, A7S.

tags.label: Techno
tags.description: Repetitive, hypnotic electronic music focused on rhythm and texture, often with a dark, industrial feel and a 4/4 kick drum. Examples: Kraftwerk, Jeff Mills, "The Bells" by Jeff Mills.

tags.label: Dubstep
tags.description: Characterized by sparse, syncopated drum patterns with prominent sub-bass frequencies. Examples: Skrillex, Benga, Skream.

tags.label: Electro
tags.description: Characterized by funk-inspired rhythms played on drum machines like the TR-808. Example: "Planet Rock" by Afrika Bambaataa & The Soulsonic Force.

tags.label: Future Bass
tags.description: Known for its hard-hitting bass, detuned synths, and often euphoric feel. Examples: Flume, Illenium.

tags.label: Electronica Downtempo
tags.description: Broad term for slower-paced, atmospheric electronic music. Examples: Boards of Canada, Massive Attack, Bonobo.

tags.label: Berlin School
tags.description: A style of electronic music characterized by long, atmospheric tracks with prominent sequencers. Example: Tangerine Dream – Stratosfear.

tags.label: Synthwave
tags.description: 80s-inspired electronic music with a retro-futuristic aesthetic. Examples: Kavinsky, The Midnight, "Nightcall" by Kavinsky.

tags.label: Dreamwave
tags.description: A subgenre of synthwave with a more atmospheric, dreamy, and nostalgic quality. Examples: Com Truise, Mitch Murder.

tags.label: Chillwave
tags.description: Relaxed, dreamy, and often lo-fi synth-pop with a nostalgic vibe. Examples: Washed Out, Toro y Moi.

tags.label: Darkwave
tags.description: A darker, more gothic take on synthwave, often with somber melodies and themes. Examples: The Cure, Depeche Mode.

tags.label: Synthpop
tags.description: Pop music where the synthesizer is the dominant musical instrument. Examples: The Human League, Pet Shop Boys.

tags.label: Indie Pop
tags.description: Pop music created outside of the commercial mainstream, often with a DIY aesthetic. Examples: Belle and Sebastian, The xx.

tags.label: Ambient Pop
tags.description: Pop music that incorporates textures and atmospheres from ambient music. Examples: Cocteau Twins, M83.

tags.label: Euro Pop
tags.description: Catchy, melodic pop music originating from Europe. Examples: ABBA, Ace of Base.

tags.label: Dance Pop
tags.description: Pop music with a strong dance beat, intended for nightclubs. Examples: Lady Gaga, Madonna.

tags.label: J-pop
tags.description: Japanese pop music, known for its eclectic and polished sound.

tags.label: Electro Swing
tags.description: A modern fusion of vintage swing and jazz with electronic beats. Examples: Caravan Palace, Parov Stelar.

tags.label: Nu Jazz
tags.description: Blends jazz elements with other musical styles like funk, soul, and electronic music. Examples: St Germain, Bonobo.

tags.label: Hip Hop
tags.description: Music style consisting of stylized rhythmic music that commonly accompanies rapping.

tags.label: Lo-fi Hip Hop
tags.description: A relaxing subgenre of hip hop, often with jazz elements and a distinct lo-fi production quality. Examples: Nujabes, J Dilla.

tags.label: Soft Rock
tags.description: A more accessible and commercially-oriented form of rock music. Examples: Fleetwood Mac, Eagles.

tags.label: Classical
tags.description: Music rooted in the traditions of Western art music.

tags.label: Orchestral Hybrid
tags.description: A fusion of traditional orchestra with modern electronic elements. Examples: Two Steps From Hell, Hans Zimmer.

tags.label: Ambient
tags.description: Atmospheric music that prioritizes texture and tone over traditional structure or rhythm. Example: Brian Eno - "Music for Airports".

tags.label: New Age
tags.description: Calm, spiritual music blending electronic and acoustic sounds. Examples: Enigma – Sadeness I, Deep Forest – Lullaby, Enya – Orinoco Flow.

tags.label: Crossover
tags.description: Indicates a blend or fusion of multiple genres.

tags.label: Ethereal
tags.description: A genre descriptor for music that is extremely delicate, light, and heavenly. Examples: Cocteau Twins, Dead Can Dance.

tags.label: Futuristic
tags.description: A genre descriptor for music that sounds ahead of its time, often experimental and electronic.

tags.label: Retro-Modern
tags.description: A style that blends vintage aesthetics with contemporary production and ideas.

tags.label: Nightcore
tags.description: A style of electronic music that involves speeding up a source track by 20–30% and increasing its pitch. It gives the track a high-energy, often cute or anime-like feel.

tags.label: 60s
tags.description: Vibes of early rock, soul, and psychedelic music.

tags.label: 70s
tags.description: Vibes of disco, funk, and early electronic music.

tags.label: Early 80s
tags.description: The transition from disco to synth-pop, with analog synths and a slightly rawer feel.

tags.label: 80s
tags.description: Characterized by big synths, gated reverb, and iconic drum machines.

tags.label: 90s
tags.description: The golden age of trance, house, and rave culture.

tags.label: Y2K
tags.description: Futuristic and tech-optimistic sounds from the turn of the millennium.

tags.label: 2000s
tags.description: Sounds from the first decade of the 21st century, including indie rock and the rise of digital production.

tags.label: 2010s
tags.description: The era of EDM, trap, and modern pop production.

tags.label: Modern
tags.description: Contemporary, clean production with current sonic trends.

tags.label: Futuristic
tags.description: Sounds that evoke a sense of the future, often experimental and electronic.

tags.label: Retro-Futuristic
tags.description: A vintage vision of the future, like vaporwave or outrun. Examples: Macintosh Plus, Kavinsky.

tags.label: Cosmic
tags.description: Evokes a sense of outer space, vastness, and wonder.

tags.label: Atmospheric
tags.description: Creates a distinct and pervasive mood or feeling.

tags.label: Spacious
tags.description: Conveys a sense of openness and vastness, with plenty of room between sounds.

tags.label: Hypnotic
tags.description: Has a mesmerizing, trance-inducing quality.

tags.label: Ethereal
tags.description: Extremely delicate, light, and seemingly not of this world.

tags.label: Dreamy
tags.description: Ethereal, atmospheric, and hazy.

tags.label: Uplifting
tags.description: Positive, hopeful, and inspiring.

tags.label: Vibrant
tags.description: Full of life, energy, and bright colors.

tags.label: Dynamic
tags.description: Characterized by constant change, activity, or progress.

tags.label: Majestic
tags.description: Having or showing impressive beauty or dignity.

tags.label: Epic
tags.description: Heroic or grand in scale or character.

tags.label: Energetic
tags.description: Full of energy, lively and vigorous.

tags.label: Driving
tags.description: Propulsive and intense, creating a sense of forward motion.

tags.label: Emotional
tags.description: Evokes strong feelings, passionate and expressive.

tags.label: Expressive
tags.description: Effectively conveying thought or feeling.

tags.label: Dramatic
tags.description: Full of action, emotion, or conflict; theatrical.

tags.label: Melancholic
tags.description: Sad, thoughtful, and introspective.

tags.label: Chill
tags.description: Relaxed and easygoing.

tags.label: Dark
tags.description: Somber, mysterious, or menacing in tone.

tags.label: Soothing
tags.description: Calm, gentle, and relaxing.

tags.label: Warm
tags.description: Comforting and pleasant, often with rich analog sounds.

tags.label: Calm
tags.description: Peaceful, quiet, and without worry.

tags.label: Relaxing
tags.description: Reducing tension and anxiety.

tags.label: Peaceful
tags.description: Serene and tranquil, promoting a sense of calm.

tags.label: Bittersweet
tags.description: A mix of happy and sad feelings.

tags.label: Aggressive
tags.description: Forceful, powerful, and intense.

tags.label: Anxious
tags.description: Creates a feeling of unease or tension.

tags.label: Romantic
tags.description: Expressive of love or deep affection.

tags.label: Mysterious
tags.description: Evokes a sense of curiosity, intrigue, or the unknown.

tags.label: Trippy
tags.description: Psychedelic, creating a sense of altered perception.

tags.label: Haunting
tags.description: Beautifully sad and memorable.

tags.label: Cinematic
tags.description: Grand, epic, and evocative, suitable for a film score. Examples: Hans Zimmer, John Williams.

tags.label: Narrative
tags.description: Tells a story or follows a clear progression of events.

tags.label: Immersive
tags.description: Creates a deep, absorbing soundscape.

tags.label: Expansive Soundscapes
tags.description: Broad, sweeping audio environments that feel vast and open.

tags.label: Slow Tempo
tags.description: A relaxed, unhurried pace.

tags.label: Medium Tempo
tags.description: A moderate, walking pace.

tags.label: High Tempo
tags.description: Fast-paced, high-energy rhythm.

tags.label: Downtempo
tags.description: A slower, more relaxed tempo, often used in chill-out music.

tags.label: Upbeat
tags.description: Having a fast tempo, a cheerful mood, and a driving rhythm.

tags.label: Four-on-the-floor
tags.description: A steady, uniformly accented beat in 4/4 time.

tags.label: Syncopated
tags.description: Rhythms that emphasize off-beats, creating a groovy feel. It's the rhythmic tension that makes you want to move.

tags.label: Shuffle Rhythm
tags.description: A rhythm based on triplets with a characteristic "swing" feel.

tags.label: Swing
tags.description: A rhythmic feel where the first note in a pair is longer than the second, common in jazz.

tags.label: Groovy
tags.description: Having a strong, infectious rhythm that makes you want to dance.

tags.label: Polyrhythm
tags.description: The simultaneous use of two or more conflicting rhythms.

tags.label: Driving Beat
tags.description: A strong, propulsive rhythm that pushes the track forward.

tags.label: Breakbeat
tags.description: Characterized by syncopated rhythms using sampled drum breaks.

tags.label: Big Beat
tags.description: A 90s style with heavy breakbeats and synthesizer-generated loops. Examples: The Chemical Brothers, Fatboy Slim.

tags.label: Drum & Bass
tags.description: Fast breakbeats (typically 160-180 bpm) with heavy basslines. Examples: Goldie, Pendulum.

tags.label: 16th-note TB-303 acidline
tags.description: The classic squelchy, rhythmic pattern of a TB-303.

tags.label: Melodic Hooks
tags.description: Catchy melodic phrases that stick in the listener's head.

tags.label: Catchy Hooks
tags.description: Memorable musical or lyrical phrases.

tags.label: Riff
tags.description: A short, repeated musical phrase, often played by a guitar or keyboard.

tags.label: Ostinato
tags.description: A persistently repeated musical phrase or rhythm.

tags.label: Evolving Melody
tags.description: A melody that changes and develops over the course of the track. Example: "Bohemian Rhapsody" by Queen.

tags.label: Progressive
tags.description: Describes a structure that continuously develops and changes, rather than repeating verses and choruses.

tags.label: Variative
tags.description: Features significant variation and change in melodies, rhythms, or textures throughout the track. Promotes novelty over repetition.

tags.label: Transformative
tags.description: The track undergoes a fundamental shift or transformation in its character or genre. A more extreme version of "variative".

tags.label: Modular
tags.description: Music constructed from repeating and evolving short melodic or rhythmic cells, similar to the style of Mike Oldfield.

tags.label: Countermelodies
tags.description: A secondary melody played in counterpoint to the primary melody.

tags.label: Layered Harmonies
tags.description: Multiple vocal or instrumental parts singing different notes to create rich chords.

tags.label: Chordal Support
tags.description: The underlying harmony that supports the main melody.

tags.label: Chord Progression
tags.description: A series of musical chords that forms the harmonic foundation of a piece.

tags.label: Call-and-response
tags.description: A succession of two distinct phrases where the second phrase is a direct commentary on or response to the first.

tags.label: Melodic Transitions
tags.description: Smooth, musical shifts between sections.

tags.label: Melodic Shifts
tags.description: Noticeable changes in the melody between different sections of the song.

tags.label: Phrase Extension
tags.description: A technique where a musical phrase is elongated or developed beyond its expected length.

tags.label: Modulation
tags.description: The act of changing from one key (tonic, or tonal center) to another.

tags.label: Embellishments
tags.description: Ornamental notes that add decoration to a melody.

tags.label: Harmonic Embellishment
tags.description: Adding notes to chords to make the harmony more complex and interesting.

tags.label: Melodic Embellishment
tags.description: Adding decorative notes like trills and turns to a melody line.

tags.label: Anthemic
tags.description: A powerful, uplifting track meant to be sung by a crowd.

tags.label: Improvised Solo
tags.description: A solo that is created spontaneously by the performer.

tags.label: Ornamental Piano Solo
tags.description: A decorative and elaborate piano solo.

tags.label: Intro
tags.description: The beginning of the track, often building energy.

tags.label: Fade-in
tags.description: A gradual increase in volume at the beginning of the track.

tags.label: Verse
tags.description: A recurring section of a song that typically features new lyrics with each repetition.

tags.label: Pre-chorus
tags.description: A short section that builds tension leading into the chorus.

tags.label: Chorus
tags.description: The main, repeated section of a song, containing the primary musical and lyrical ideas.

tags.label: Bridge
tags.description: A contrasting section that provides a transition between other parts of a song.

tags.label: Instrumental Bridge
tags.description: A bridge section without vocals, focusing on the instruments.

tags.label: Instrumental break
tags.description: A section where the vocals drop out and the instruments take focus.

tags.label: Build-up
tags.description: A section of rising tension and energy.

tags.label: Breakdown
tags.description: A sparse section where rhythmic elements are removed.

tags.label: Risers
tags.description: A sound effect with a rising pitch, used to build tension.

tags.label: Crescendos
tags.description: A gradual increase in volume or intensity.

tags.label: Drop
tags.description: The moment the main beat and bassline kick in with full energy.

tags.label: Outro
tags.description: The end of the track, fading out or simplifying elements.

tags.label: Fade-out
tags.description: A gradual decrease in volume at the end of the track.

tags.label: DJ-friendly intro/outro
tags.description: Extended, beat-only sections for mixing.

tags.label: Cosmic Journey
tags.description: A track structure that takes the listener on a long, evolving trip, often with distinct movements or phases.

tags.label: Swells
tags.description: Gradual increases in volume, often from string or synth pads, creating a wave-like effect.

tags.label: Polyphonic
tags.description: Consisting of two or more simultaneous lines of independent melody.

tags.label: Dynamic Shifts
tags.description: Variations in volume and intensity throughout the track.

tags.label: Warm
tags.description: A sound texture that is pleasant, rich, and often associated with analog equipment.

tags.label: Smooth
tags.description: A sound texture that is flowing, connected, and without harshness.

tags.label: Ambient
tags.description: A texture that creates an atmospheric, surrounding soundscape.

tags.label: Futuristic
tags.description: Sound textures that evoke a sense of the future, often synthetic and clean.

tags.label: Mechanical
tags.description: Incorporating mechanical or industrial sounds for texture.

tags.label: Industrial
tags.description: A harsh, aggressive sound texture using sounds from industrial machinery.

tags.label: Synthesizer
tags.description: The core of electronic music.

tags.label: Layered Synths
tags.description: Multiple synthesizer sounds combined to create a rich, complex texture.

tags.label: Warm Pads
tags.description: Lush, sustained chords that create atmosphere.

tags.label: Soft Pads
tags.description: Gentle, atmospheric pads with a soft attack.

tags.label: Supersaw
tags.description: A detuned, layered sawtooth wave, classic in trance. Example: "Sandstorm" by Darude.

tags.label: Bass Guitar
tags.description: The sound of an electric bass guitar.

tags.label: Sub-bass
tags.description: Very low-frequency bass content, felt more than heard.

tags.label: Gritty Bass
tags.description: A distorted, aggressive bass sound.

tags.label: Piano
tags.description: Acoustic or electric piano for melody or chords.

tags.label: Harpsichord
tags.description: A historical keyboard instrument with a distinctive plucked string sound.

tags.label: Acoustic Guitar
tags.description: The sound of an acoustic guitar.

tags.label: Electric Guitar
tags.description: The sound of an electric guitar, can be clean or distorted.

tags.label: Strings
tags.description: Violins, cellos, etc., either acoustic or synthesized.

tags.label: Brass Section
tags.description: Trumpets, trombones, horns, etc.

tags.label: Woodwinds
tags.description: Flutes, clarinets, oboes, etc.

tags.label: Orchestra
tags.description: A large ensemble of classical instruments.

tags.label: Shimmering Bells
tags.description: Bright, metallic, or crystalline bell sounds.

tags.label: Gated Arpeggios
tags.description: Arpeggios with a rhythmic "gating" effect applied.

tags.label: Drones
tags.description: Long, sustained, low-frequency sounds.

tags.label: Choir
tags.description: Vocal chorus, can be angelic, epic, or haunting.

tags.label: Vocoder
tags.description: A synthesizer that produces a robotic vocal effect. Examples: Daft Punk - "Around the World", Kraftwerk - "The Robots".

tags.label: Sitar
tags.description: A plucked stringed instrument originating from the Indian subcontinent. Examples: Ravi Shankar, The Beatles - "Norwegian Wood".

tags.label: Drum Machine
tags.description: Programmed, electronic percussion.

tags.label: Sampler
tags.description: An electronic instrument that uses sound recordings (samples) as a source.

tags.label: Minimoog
tags.description: The archetypal analog monosynth, famous for its fat bass and lead sounds. Examples: Parliament-Funkadelic, Kraftwerk.

tags.label: Prophet-5
tags.description: Legendary synth with a powerful, distinctly American sound. Examples: Radiohead, Talking Heads.

tags.label: Jupiter-8
tags.description: Iconic poly-synth famous for its warm, rich analog sound. Example: Michael Jackson - "Thriller".

tags.label: Juno-106
tags.description: Classic Roland poly-synth known for lush pads and chorus. Example: A-ha - "Take On Me".

tags.label: Oberheim OB-Xa
tags.description: A massive-sounding polysynth famous for the "Jump" sound. Example: Van Halen - "Jump".

tags.label: DX7
tags.description: A classic FM synthesizer that defined the sound of the 80s. Example: A-ha - "Take On Me".

tags.label: Roland D-50
tags.description: A late 80s digital synth known for its atmospheric, breathy textures. Example: Enya.

tags.label: Korg M1
tags.description: A workstation synthesizer that defined the sound of late 80s and early 90s house music. Example: Robin S - "Show Me Love".

tags.label: SQ-80
tags.description: A late 80s digital/analog hybrid synth known for its gritty and unique character.

tags.label: CS-80
tags.description: Iconic Yamaha poly-synth, famous for its expressive controls and the "Blade Runner" sound. Example: Vangelis.

tags.label: TB-303
tags.description: The source of the "acid" sound with its squelchy, resonant filter. Example: Phuture - "Acid Tracks".

tags.label: TR-808
tags.description: The legendary drum machine with deep kicks and snappy snares. Example: Marvin Gaye - "Sexual Healing".

tags.label: TR-909
tags.description: The heartbeat of house and techno, known for its punchy kick and hi-hats. Examples: Daft Punk, Jeff Mills.

tags.label: LinnDrum
tags.description: An iconic 80s drum machine using sampled sounds, defining the sound of pop music of that era. Example: Prince.

tags.label: Minimalist
tags.description: A sparse arrangement with few elements.

tags.label: Maximalist
tags.description: A dense, layered arrangement with many elements.

tags.label: Layered
tags.description: Features multiple overlapping sounds and musical parts.

tags.label: Sidechain Pumping
tags.description: The volume of pads/bass ducks in time with the kick drum. Example: Daft Punk - "One More Time".

tags.label: Punchy
tags.description: Emphasizes the transient attack of sounds, especially drums.

tags.label: Compressed
tags.description: Reduced dynamic range, making quiet parts louder and loud parts quieter.

tags.label: Dynamic Range
tags.description: A large difference between the quietest and loudest parts of the track.

tags.label: Tape-like Saturation
tags.description: Adds warmth, harmonics, and subtle compression.

tags.label: Gated Reverb
tags.description: A classic 80s effect with a sharp reverb tail cutoff. Example: Phil Collins - "In the Air Tonight".

tags.label: Warm / Analog
tags.description: Rich low-mids, smooth highs, often with saturation.

tags.label: Wide Stereo Image
tags.description: Sounds are spread far to the left and right.

tags.label: Dry Mix
tags.description: Few time-based effects like reverb or delay.

tags.label: Wet Mix
tags.description: Heavy use of effects like reverb and delay.

tags.label: Ambient Reverb
tags.description: Large, spacious reverb that creates a sense of atmosphere.

tags.label: Reverb-heavy
tags.description: The mix is dominated by reverb effects.

tags.label: Glossy / Modern
tags.description: Bright, clean, and polished sound.

tags.label: Polished
tags.description: A clean, professional, and well-balanced mix.

tags.label: Lo-fi
tags.description: Intentionally imperfect, with noise, wow, and flutter. Examples: Nujabes, J Dilla.

tags.label: Experimental
tags.description: Breaks conventional rules of music, exploring new sounds and structures.

tags.label: Distorted
tags.description: An effect that alters the sound to be "dirty" or "gritty".

tags.label: Glitch
tags.description: Incorporates sounds of malfunctioning audio or digital errors as a rhythmic or textural element. Examples: Aphex Twin, Autechre.

tags.label: Synth Modulation
tags.description: Using effects like LFOs or envelopes to create movement and change in synthesizer sounds.

tags.label: Instrumental
tags.description: No vocals.

tags.label: Female Vocals
tags.description: Lead vocals by a female singer.

tags.label: Male Vocals
tags.description: Lead vocals by a male singer.

tags.label: Duet
tags.description: A performance by two singers.

tags.label: Airy / Soft Vocals
tags.description: Gentle, breathy vocal performance.

tags.label: Powerful Vocals
tags.description: Strong, commanding vocal performance.

tags.label: Falsetto
tags.description: A high-pitched vocal style. Examples: Bee Gees, Prince, The Weeknd.

tags.label: Layered Harmonies
tags.description: Multiple vocal parts singing different notes.

tags.label: Background Vocals
tags.description: Supporting vocal parts behind the lead.

tags.label: Ad-libs
tags.description: Improvised vocal lines, often in the background.

tags.label: Intimate / Subdued
tags.description: A close, personal, and quiet vocal style.

tags.label: Spoken Word
tags.description: Vocal delivery in a spoken style. Example: "Everybody's Free (To Wear Sunscreen)" by Baz Luhrmann

tags.label: Rapping
tags.description: Rhyming or rhythmic speech.

tags.label: Chanting
tags.description: Repetitive singing or speaking of words or sounds.

tags.label: Chopped Vocals
tags.description: Vocal samples that are cut up and re-sequenced rhythmically. Examples: Skrillex, Burial.

tags.label: Echoing Lyrics
tags.description: Background vocals that repeat or echo the main lyrical phrases. Example: "Africa" by Toto.

tags.label: Music for chilling and falling asleep
tags.description: Designed for relaxation and sleep.

tags.label: Music for studying
tags.description: Background music that aids concentration.

tags.label: Workout music
tags.description: High-energy music for exercise.

tags.label: Driving music
tags.description: Music suitable for listening to while driving.

tags.label: Background music
tags.description: Unobtrusive music that can be played in the background.

tags.label: DJ set
tags.description: Suitable for inclusion in a DJ mix.

tags.label: Dancefloor
tags.description: High-energy, designed for dancing in a club.

taxonomy.name: Lyrics/Theme
taxonomy.description: Enter a short concept or theme for the lyrics (e.g., "english lyrics about secrets", "storytelling", "empowerment"). This will be added to your prompt.

taxonomy.name: References
taxonomy.description: Add artist or track references (e.g., "Lady Gaga", "by Pierre Siffre"). Note: This is a user-editable field and does not guarantee style matching.
